Abstract: This study examines the complex and multifaceted role of business leaders in shaping political outcomes. Through a comprehensive review of existing literature and case studies, we investigate the ways in which CEOs and corporate leaders engage in lobbying, advocacy, and civic engagement to influence policy decisions. Our analysis highlights the significant impact of corporate social responsibility initiatives and CEO activism on policy agendas, demonstrating that business leaders can play a crucial role in promoting positive social and environmental change. We also explore the tensions between corporate interests and public values, highlighting the need for greater transparency and accountability in the political activities of business leaders. Ultimately, our research underscores the importance of considering the political role of business leaders in understanding the dynamics of power and influence in contemporary politics.
